material.mattext: What is P(not E|not M), the probability that a randomly chosen female does not have pierced ears?

Incorrect. Your denominator is right, we are conditioning on the student being a female, and therefore restricting ourselves only to the 320 female students. However, note that 288 out of the females are pierced and we asked P(not E|not M).

Incorrect. If your denominator is 176, this means that you restrict yourselves to the second column, or, in other words, you condition on the fact that the student is not pierced (not E). 32/176, then represents P(not M|not E), and we are looking for P(not E|not M).
Good Job! When you condition on not M, this means that we are restricting ourselves only to the 320 female students. Indeed, among them, 32 are not pierced, and therefore 32/320 is the right answer.

Incorrect. If your denominator is 500, this means that you are choosing among the 500 students, without assuming (or conditioning on) anything. 32/500 represents, then, the probability that a randomly chosen student is a non-pierced female - P(not E and not M). Note that we are looking for P(not E |not M) - we are conditioning on the student being a female or in other words, we are choosing only from the 320 females.
